page.title: 07Transport - Railway disused
page.content:
The railway boom started in the 1860's but it wasn't until the 1880's that our area of study had a railway of its own. It was called the Freshwater and Newport Railway Company. It opened for business in September 1888. It had a lot of problems with the I.O.W. Centeral Railway which wouldn't let it use Newport Station. The line was never successful and finally closed in 1962.
To carry out our study we stayed at the old Yarmouth Railway Station which is now a Youth Centre. The building was largely intact although a large prefabricated hut has been built on the end of it which is the Youth Centre hall. The platform is there but the railway tracks have all been taken away. The track has now, in parts, been ......
